comments.creator: rimas@mozilla.lt
comments.text:
It seems like our "jump lists" for Windows and OS X are not kept in sync. Right now, the Jumplist for Windows contains these items:
* Open New Tab
* Open New Window
* Start Private Browsing
meanwhile its OS X counterpart I think only contains the first option – Open New Tab.

I think it would sound logical for these lists to be kept in sync. Perhaps their generation should even be abstracted to into a platform agnostic function/module/whatever in Toolkit?
comments.author: rimas@mozilla.lt
comments.raw_text:
It seems like our "jump lists" for Windows and OS X are not kept in sync. Right now, the Jumplist for Windows contains these items:
* Open New Tab
* Open New Window
* Start Private Browsing
meanwhile its OS X counterpart I think only contains the first option – Open New Tab.

I think it would sound logical for these lists to be kept in sync. Perhaps their generation should even be abstracted to into a platform agnostic function/module/whatever in Toolkit?
Oh, I also forgot to mention jump list categories, such as 'Frequent'. Our jump lists on Windows currently feature them. On OS X, I think these categories could be turned into submenus.
comments.author: rimas@mozilla.lt

comments.raw_text: The bug title says "in sync", as in "synchronized", not "in Sync", as in "in Firefox Sync".
